channel.title: SCoRe Lab
channel.description: Write an awesome description for your new site here. You can edit this line in _config.yml. It will appear in your document head meta (for Google search results) and in your feed.xml site description.

item.title: Blog: SCoRe published 3 posters at SENSYS 2017
item.description: Two of our researchers Mr. Prabhash Kumarasinghe and Ms. Dilushi Piyumwardhana presented three posters at SENSYS 2017 conference based on ASSEST and D4D projects at Delft, The Netherlands on November 5-8, 2017.

item.title: Blog: SCoRe addressed ICTer 2017
item.description:
One of our researchers Ms. Akarshani Amarasinghe addressed ICTer 2017 conference entitled Suppressing Dengue via a Drone System at University of Colombo School of Computing, Sri Lanka.

The Authors as follows;

  1. Akarshani Amarasinghe
  2. Chathura Suduwella
  3. Lasith Niroshan
  4. Charith Elwitigala
  5. Dr. Kasun De Zoysa
  6. Dr. Chamath Keppetiyagama

item.title: Blog: SCoRe addressed DRONET 2017
item.description:
One of our heads Dr. Kasun De Zoysa addressed DRONET 2017 conference entitled Identifying Mosquito Breeding Sites via Drone Images at Niagara Falls, New York, USA on June 23, 2017.

The Authors as follows;

  1. Chathura Suduwella
  2. Akarshani Amarasinghe
  3. Lasith Niroshan
  4. Charith Elwitigala
  5. Dr. Kasun De Zoysa
  6. Dr. Chamath Keppetiyagama

item.title: Blog: SCoRe won Best Paper Award at DCOSS 2017
item.description:
SCoRe Group won the Best Paper Award for ASSEST project at DCOSS conference. Dr. Chamath Keppetiyagama presented the paper on Elephant Detection. The conference was held at Ottawa, Canada on June 5-7, 2017.

The Authors as follows;

  1. Asanka Sayakkara
  2. Namal Jayasuriya
  3. Tharindu Ranathunga
  4. Chathura Suduwella
  5. Nithila Withanage
  6. Dr. Chamath Keppetiyagama
  7. Dr. Kasun De Zoysa
  8. Kasun Hewage
  9. Prof. Thiemo Voigt

item.title: Blog: A New Mosquito - Rivira newspaper article
item.description:
Drone for Dengue (D4D) is a system for detecting dengue mosquito breeding sites via drone images. Public Health Inspectors (PHIs) in Sri Lanka are facing a problem of identifying certain mosquito breeding sites since they cannot easily reach places such as roof gutters, overhead water tanks, inaccessible rooftops and cement materials which are capable of retaining water.

Rivira Article

item.title: Blog: A Drone Mission for Dengue - Lakbima newspaper article
item.description: Drone for Dengue (D4D) is a system for detecting dengue mosquito breeding sites via drone images. Public Health Inspectors (PHIs) in Sri Lanka are facing a problem of identifying certain mosquito breeding sites since they cannot easily reach places such as roof gutters, overhead water tanks, inaccessible rooftops and cement materials which are capable of retaining water.
